Sorry, committed that too early.

build I20060208-0848

Saw this while running the UI team's performance tests.
The test in question rapidly opens and closes a workbench window.

The asyncExec in LaunchView.initializeSelections() job should check isAvailable() not only when queuing the async exec, but also when it's about to be run, since the view may have been closed between queuing and running. 
All asyncExecs should double check.

This check could be done for all callers in AbstractDebugView.asyncExec using a wrapper runnable.
Fixed in LaunchView. The initializeSelection did not need a job, it's already called in an async, so the check isAvailable() is now done at the right time.
